title: 115_hr1574
content: The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" is a bill that aims to provide viewpoint protection in communications. It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include provisions for protecting viewpoints. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the Commission from taking action against any person based on the viewpoints expressed on issues of public importance in their broadcast or dissemination of content. Additionally, the Commission cannot impose conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. The bill prohibits the Commission from taking action based on viewpoints expressed on public issues in content broadcast or disseminated. It also prevents the Commission from imposing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. The bill prohibits the Commission from taking action based on viewpoints expressed on public issues in content broadcast or disseminated, including violations of specific sections of the United States Code. The bill prohibits the Commission from taking action based on viewpoints expressed on public issues in content broadcast or disseminated, including violations of specific sections of the United States Code related to radio communication, public interest obligations, and incitement under the First Amendment. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to retaliate against individuals based on their viewpoints expressed in broadcast or disseminated content on public issues. This includes actions related to incitement under the First Amendment. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to impose conditions on approvals or decisions based on the viewpoints expressed in broadcast or disseminated content on public issues. This includes actions related to incitement under the First Amendment. The bill prohibits the President from influencing agency decisions based on broadcast content or public viewpoints, including incitement under the First Amendment. This does not affect the President's authority to direct agencies on certain matters. The bill prohibits the President from influencing agency decisions based on broadcast content or public viewpoints, including incitement under the First Amendment. It includes violations of specific sections of Title 18 of the United States Code. The bill prohibits the President from influencing agency decisions based on broadcast content or public viewpoints, including incitement under the First Amendment and violations of specific sections of Title 18 of the United States Code. The bill prohibits the President from influencing agency decisions based on broadcast content or public viewpoints, including incitement under the First Amendment and violations of specific sections of Title 18 of the United States Code. The term "agency" is defined in this subsection as per section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
